definitions: The quality or state of being atomic; indivisibility.
In database systems, the property of a transaction that ensures that all of its operations are either completed successfully or none of them are.
In concurrent programming, the property of an operation that ensures it is treated as a single, uninterruptible unit.
examples: The atomicity of the element makes it fundamental.
Database transactions require atomicity to maintain data integrity.
Ensuring atomicity in multithreaded operations is crucial.
